intro: Galenia linearis, commonly known as the slender galenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. Galenia linearis is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
